title: Qatar, Nepal, Bangladesh: Emir's Visits Should Prioritize Migrant Worker Protections - Human Rights Watch
description: Qatar, Nepal, Bangladesh: Emir's Visits Should Prioritize Migrant Worker Protections  Human Rights Watch
publisher.title: Human Rights Watch
full_article:
Click to expand Image Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani, emir of Qatar, in Doha, November 29, 2023. © 2023 Bernd von Jutrczenka/picture-alliance/dpa/AP Photo

(Beirut) – The upcoming visits of the Emir of Qatar, Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad al-Thani, to Bangladesh and Nepal should prioritize labor protections for migrant workers, Human Rights Watch said today. Both are key countries for Qatar’s migrant workforce, which makes up 88 percent of the country’s population. Al-Thani is expected to arrive in Bangladesh on April 22, 2024, and in Nepal on April 24.

“It is important for Qatar, Bangladesh, and Nepal to go beyond exchanging diplomatic pleasantries over their longstanding labor ties and seize this moment to publicly commit to concrete, enforceable protections that address the serious abuses that migrant workers in Qatar continue to face,” said Michael Page, deputy Middle East and North Africa director at Human Rights Watch. “The Qatari emir should not just meet heads of state, but also visit dialysis centers filled with migrant worker returnees from Qatar and speak with the families of workers who died in Qatar to see the grave consequences of inadequate Qatari labor protections.”

Migrant workers from Bangladesh and Nepal have been indispensable to Qatar’s economy, including in the preparation and delivery of the 2022 World Cup. The Qatar-to-Nepal and Bangladesh routes that the Qatari leader is taking are well-trodden, with thousands of workers making this journey daily. As “guest workers” in a country that does not offer citizenship to most foreigners, the expectation is that workers come to Qatar to work, earn money, and, sooner or later, leave.

Qatar-based jobs have enabled migrant workers to send remittances back home to their families, but many workers leave Qatar worse off than before they migrated. They experience abuses that include wage theft, contract violations, and chronic illness linked to unsafe working conditions.

Many migrant workers do outdoor work and are exposed to Qatar’s extreme heat, and the lack of worker protections from this serious health hazard can take a devastating toll. Some workers also have been deported for demanding their contractually-owed wages and benefits. There have been thousands of unexplained deaths of young, healthy migrant workers in Qatar, and in many cases grieving families grieving family members receive neither an explanation of the reasons for their loved ones’ death nor compensation justification nor compensation from employers or Qatari authorities.

The governments of Bangladesh and Nepal should not only highlight the importance of remittances but also the high costs that workers often bear to earn them, such as wage theft and recruitment fees. A 2020 survey found that the average recruitment costs for Bangladeshis going to work in Qatar was about US$3,863, equivalent to 18 months of earnings in Qatar. Workers take out informal loans at exorbitant interest rates to pay the fees. Research by Human Rights Watch has shown the role of Qatar-based companies in driving up worker-paid recruitment fees.

Qatar’s failure to safeguard worker rights and inadequate compensation mechanisms means that the responsibility is shifted to the origin countries’ governments to address harm originating in Qatar.

Many workers returning from Qatar are burdened with long-term diseases such as chronic kidney failure , for which the Nepali government provides free dialysis services. Families of many migrant workers who have lost their lives in Qatar rely on compensation through welfare funds set up unilaterally by countries of origin.

Human Rights Watch has documented the experiences of families who received no support from Qatari authorities or their employers despite losing their primary breadwinner, since the causes of their deaths are not classified as work-related.

Recognizing the inadequacies of the compensation system, Qatar’s own Supreme Committee urged its contractors to obtain life insurance for their employees, but this was adopted only by a handful of companies, even at the height of the 2022 World Cup when the world’s eyes were on Qatar’s migrant rights record.

The climate crisis is likely to worsen the risks to workers, which will further increase the care burden to overstretched healthcare systems in countries like Nepal and Bangladesh. These countries themselves are on the front lines of climate catastrophes despite their negligible greenhouse gas emissions.

Qatari authorities have introduced labor reforms, but Human Rights Watch has shown that they came too late and were too little and too narrow in scope. They have not abolished the abusive kafala (labor sponsorship) system that enables these abuses in its entirety.

Qatari authorities have claimed these reforms were not about the World Cup alone but a part of a process that continues beyond the tournament. Yet post-World Cup, many workers were stranded in Qatar in difficult conditions.

The labor agreements that are anticipated to be updated and signed during the emir’s visits should incorporate concrete provisions to address these issues, and the agreements themselves need to be made publicly available, Human Rights Watch said.

The significance of labor reforms or the agreements with migrant origin countries boils down to their implementation and their effectiveness in addressing widespread abuses, which requires strong enforcement mechanisms. Diplomatic visits, labor agreements, or labor reforms ring hollow if homecoming continues to be marred by unpaid wages or benefits, chronic kidney disease , and uninvestigated and uncompensated deaths .

“Public commitments by the Qatari emir to concrete, enforceable worker protections during these two high-profile visits, including compensation to workers who faced serious abuses and families of the deceased, would be the best way to mark his trips to the homes of millions of current and former workers who have helped transform Qatar,” Page said.
translated: Click to expand image meikh tamim bin hamad al थानी, कतार के अमीर, दोहा में, 29 नवम्बर, 2023. © 2023 बर्नड वॉन जुट्र्चेन्का/चित्र-एलिएंस/डीपीए/एपी फोटो (बेइरूत) – कतार के अमीर के आगामी भ्रमण, ह्यूमन राइट्स वॉच न॑ आय कहलकै कि बांग्लादेश आरू नेपाल क॑ शेख तामिम बिन हमद अल-थनी क॑ प्रवासी मजदूरऽ लेली श्रम संरक्षण क॑ प्राथमिकता देना चाहियऽ ।दुनू कतार केरऽ प्रवासी कार्यबल लेली प्रमुख देश छै, जेकरा म॑ देश केरऽ ८८ प्रतिशत आबादी छै ।अल-थनी 22 अप्रैल, 2024 क बांग्लादेश पहुंचबाक उम्मीद अछि, आ 24 अप्रैल कए नेपाल मे कतार, बांग्लादेश आ नेपाल क लेल इ महत्वपूर्ण अछि जे ओ अपन लंबा समय स चलय वाला श्रम संबंध क आदान-प्रदान आ सार्वजनिक रूप स एहि क्षण जब्त क कूटनीतिक सुखदता क आदान-प्रदान स आगू बढ़ि सकथि। कतार म॑ प्रवासी मजदूरऽ के सामना जारी रखै वाला गंभीर दुर्व्यवहार क॑ संबोधित करै वाला ठोस, प्रवर्तनीय सुरक्षा के प्रतिबद्ध छै,’’ ह्यूमन राइट्स वॉच केरऽ उप मध्य पूर्व आरू उत्तरी अफ्रीका निदेशक माइकल पेज न॑ कहलकै ।“कतारी अमीर क॑ खाली राज्य केरऽ प्रमुखऽ स॑ भेंट नै करलऽ जाय, बल्कि कतार स॑ प्रवासी मजदूरऽ के वापसी करै वाला स॑ भरलऽ डायलिसिस केंद्रऽ प॑ जाय क॑ कतार म॑ मरलऽ मजदूरऽ के परिवारऽ स॑ बात करै लेली कतारी श्रम संरक्षण केरऽ अपर्याप्तता के गंभीर परिणाम देखै के चाही।”बांग्लादेश आरू नेपाल केरऽ प्रवासी मजदूर कतार केरऽ अर्थव्यवस्था लेली अनिवार्य रहलऽ छै, जेकरा म॑ २०२२ केरऽ विश्व कप केरऽ तैयारी आरू वितरण भी शामिल छै ।कतारी के नेता जे कतार आ बांग्लादेश के मार्ग पर जा रहल अछि ओ नीक सं चलय वाला अछि, जाहि मे हजारों मजदूर रोजाना ई यात्रा करैत अछि.जेना कि अधिकांश विदेशी के नागरिकता के प्रस्ताव नै दै वाला देश में “अतिथि मजदूर”, अपेक्षा ई छै कि मजदूर काम करै लेली, पैसा कमाबै लेली, आरू देर-सबेर, छोड़ै लेली कतार में आबै छै.कतार स्थित नौकरी स प्रवासी मजदूर कए अपन परिवार कए वापस घर भेजबा मे सक्षम बना देल गेल अछि, मुदा बहुत रास मजदूर कतार कए पलायन करबा स पहिने बेसी खराब छोड़ि दैत अछि।हुनका दुर्व्यवहार कें अनुभव होयत छै, जेकरा मे मजदूरी चोरी, अनुबंध कें उल्लंघन, आ असुरक्षित कार्य परिस्थितिक सं जुड़ल पुरानी बीमारी शामिल छै.बहुत सं प्रवासी श्रमिक बाहरी काज करएयत छै आ कतार कें अत्यधिक गर्मी कें संपर्क मे छै, आ स्वास्थ्य संबंधी खतरा सं श्रमिकक कें सुरक्षा कें कमी सं विनाशकारी नुकसान भ सकएय छै.किछु मजदूर कए अपन अनुबंधित मजदूरी आ लाभ क मांग करबाक कारण सेहो देश निकाला कैल गेल अछि।कतार में युवा, स्वस्थ प्रवासी मजदूर के हजारों अस्पष्ट मृत्यु भेल अछि, आ बहुत मामला में परिवार के शोक संतप्त परिवार के सदस्य के अपन प्रियजन के मौत के कारण के न त व्याख्या भेटैत अछि आ न ही नियोक्ता या कतारी के अधिकारि के मुआवजा के मुआवजा.बांग्लादेश आरू नेपाल के सरकारऽ क॑ न सिर्फ रेमिटैंस के महत्व प॑ प्रकाश डालना चाहियऽ बल्कि मजदूरऽ क॑ अक्सर ओकरा कमाय लेली जे उच्च लागत स॑ मिलै छै, जेना कि मजदूरी चोरी आरू भर्ती शुल्क ।2020 केरऽ एगो सर्वेक्षण म॑ पता चललै कि कतार म॑ काम करै वाला बांग्लादेशी सिनी लेली औसतन भर्ती केरऽ लागत लगभग 3,863 अमेरिकी डॉलर छेलै, जे कतार म॑ 18 महीना के कमाई के बराबर छै ।श्रमिक शुल्क कें भुगतान कें लेल अत्यधिक ब्याज दर पर अनौपचारिक ऋण लैत छै.ह्यूमन राइट्स वॉच केरऽ शोध स॑ कतार स्थित कंपनी सिनी के भूमिका मजदूरऽ द्वारा देलऽ गेलऽ भर्ती शुल्क क॑ बढ़ाबै म॑ देखलऽ गेलऽ छै ।कतार केरऽ श्रमिक अधिकार आरू अपर्याप्त मुआवजा तंत्र के सुरक्षा म॑ विफलता के मतलब छै कि कतर स॑ उत्पन्न नुकसान के समाधान लेली उत्पत्ति देशऽ के सरकारऽ प॑ जिम्मेदारी बदली देलऽ जाय छै ।कतार सं लौटय वाला बहुत रास मजदूर पुरानी गुर्दा के विफलता जैना दीर्घकालिक बीमारी सं बोझिल छै , जेकरा लेल नेपाली सरकार मुफ्त डायलिसिस सेवा प्रदान करय छै.कतार मे अपन जान गंवा चुकल बहुत सं प्रवासी श्रमिकक कें परिवारक कें मुआवजा पर निर्भर छै जे कल्याणकारी धनराशि कें माध्यम सं मूल देशक कें द्वारा एकतरफा बना देल गेल छै.ह्यूमन राइट्स वॉच न॑ अपनऽ प्राथमिक रोटी-रोटी के छोडला के बावजूद कतारी केरऽ अधिकारियऽ या ओकरऽ नियोक्ता सिनी के कोय समर्थन नै मिललऽ परिवारऽ के अनुभव के दस्तावेजीकरण करलकै, कैन्हेंकि ओकरऽ मौत के कारण क॑ काम स॑ संबंधित के रूप म॑ वर्गीकृत नै करलऽ गेलऽ छै ।मुआवजा प्रणाली केरऽ अपर्याप्तता क॑ स्वीकार करी क॑ कतार केरऽ अपनऽ सुप्रीम कमेटी न॑ अपनऽ ठेकेदारऽ स॑ आग्रह करलकै कि वू अपनऽ कर्मचारी सिनी लेली जीवन बीमा प्राप्त करै, लेकिन एकरा केवल मुट्ठी भर कंपनी न॑ अपनान॑ छेलै, 2022 केरऽ विश्व कप केरऽ चरम पर भी जब॑ विश्व केरऽ आँख कतार प॑ छेलै । प्रवासी अधिकार रिकॉर्ड।जलवायु संकट स॑ मजदूरऽ लेली जोखिम क॑ खराब करलऽ जाय के संभावना छै, जेकरा स॑ नेपाल आरू बांग्लादेश जैसनऽ देशऽ म॑ स्वास्थ्य सेवा प्रणाली केरऽ ओवरस्ट्रेचिंग सिस्टम प॑ आरू बढ़तै ।ई देश खुद अपनऽ नगण्य ग्रीनहाउस गैस उत्सर्जन के बावजूद जलवायु प्रलय के मोर्चा पर छै ।कतारी केरऽ अधिकारियऽ न॑ श्रम सुधारऽ के शुरूआत करलकै, लेकिन ह्यूमन राइट्स वॉच न॑ ई देखान॑ छै कि वू बहुत देर स॑ आबी गेलै आरू बहुत कम आरू बहुत संकीर्ण छेलै ।ओ सब गारि-गरौबलि (श्रम प्रायोजन) प्रणाली के समाप्त नै केने छथि जे एहि दुरुपयोग के पूरा तरह स सक्षम बनाबैत अछि |कतारी केरऽ अधिकारियऽ न॑ दावा करल॑ छै कि ई सुधार केवल विश्व कप के बारे म॑ नै बल्कि एगो ऐसनऽ प्रक्रिया के हिस्सा छै जे टूर्नामेंट स॑ आगू बढ़ी रहलऽ छै ।तइयो विश्वक बादक कप मे कठिन परिस्थिति मे कतार मे कतेको मजदूर फँसि गेल छल ।ह्यूमन राइट्स वॉच न॑ कहलकै कि अमीर केरऽ दौरा के दौरान जे श्रम समझौता क॑ अपडेट करी क॑ हस्ताक्षर करलऽ जाय के अनुमान छै, ओकरा म॑ ई मुद्दा प॑ ध्यान दै लेली ठोस प्रावधानऽ क॑ शामिल करलऽ जाना चाहियऽ, आरू खुद समझौता क॑ सार्वजनिक रूप स॑ उपलब्ध करलऽ जाय के जरूरत छै ।श्रम सुधारक या प्रवासी मूल देशक कें साथ समझौताक कें महत्व ओकर कार्यान्वयन आ व्यापक दुरुपयोग कें संबोधित करय मे ओकर प्रभावशीलता कें लेल उबालि जाय छै, जेकरा मे मजबूत प्रवर्तन तंत्र कें आवश्यकता छै.कूटनीतिक दौरा, श्रम समझौता, या श्रम सुधार खोखला खोखला पर खोखला बजैत अछि जखन घरक वापसी अदत्त मजदूरी या लाभ, पुरान गुर्दा रोग , आ अविवेकी आ अनुकुआत मृत्यु सं भ्रामम होइत रहैत अछि .“कतारी अमीर द्वारा कंक्रीट, प्रवर्तनीय श्रमिक संरक्षण के ई दूनू हाई प्रोफाइल दौरा के दौरान, जाहि में गंभीर दुर्व्यवहार आ मृतक के परिवार के परिवार के मुआवजा शामिल छै, के दौरान मुआवजा सहित, लाखों के घर के घर के घर के यात्रा के चिन्हित करय के लेल सबस नीक तरीका होयत. वर्तमान आरू पूर्व मजदूर जे कतार क॑ बदलै म॑ मदद करलकै,’’ पेज न॑ कहलकै ।

title: Travel Kind: Hong Kong physiotherapists give back to local communities on their trip to Nepal - South China Morning Post
description: Travel Kind: Hong Kong physiotherapists give back to local communities on their trip to Nepal  South China Morning Post
publisher.title: South China Morning Post
full_article:
Difficulty: Challenger (Level 2)

When people go on holiday, they usually enjoy sightseeing and relaxing in a new place. But when Gigi Fu Wing-chi and Sylvia Lee Wing-yi joined a trip to Nepal last December, they were also giving back to the local community.

Both Fu and Lee are physiotherapists from Hong Kong. On their week-long visit to Nepal, they led injury prevention workshops. These were for 15 young women studying to become trekking guides. In Nepal, trekking guides help visitors explore the Himalayan mountains.

Armed with a 30-page guidebook they created, the physiotherapists shared their knowledge about hiking’s effect on the skin and joints.

“Many of the girls are actually pursuing their bachelor’s or master’s degrees. They are very passionate about trekking,” Fu shared. The 24-year-old works in a Hong Kong public hospital.

“Becoming a trekking guide is not just about making money. They love this activity and want to engage with foreigners by introducing them to the beauty of their country.”

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"ImageObject","caption":"On a week-long trip, four physiotherapists from Hong Kong led injury prevention workshops. Photo: Handout","url":"https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/d8/images/canvas/2024/04/17/2b3df42c-138b-435d-b3c8-a6968cb95503_d3c53ba7.jpg"} On a week-long trip, four physiotherapists from Hong Kong led injury prevention workshops. Photo: Handout

Travel Kind

This South Asian country has beautiful natural scenery and many of the world’s tallest peaks. Being a mountain trail guide is considered a high-paying job. But it is also a dangerous profession that is usually done by men.

“I thought physiotherapy would be the right fit to support those girls. This is because being trekking guides requires physical fitness, and they face a chance of injury,” explained the trip organiser, Rosina Shing Shuk-han.

The volunteer trip to Nepal was the first one for Shing’s charity, Travel Kind. She co-founded the NGO in 2018 to encourage Hongkongers to give back when they travel.

The organiser worked with a Nepalese charity, 3 Summits for Nepal. The NGO helps girls in rural areas escape poverty by training them to become trail guides. Travel Kind hoped to empower these young women to pursue their dreams.

The trip was organised for physiotherapists to share their skills with the trekking guides. Each traveller from Hong Kong paid HK$10,970.

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"ImageObject","caption":"The volunteers had the opportunity to learn about Nepalese culture. Photos: Handout","url":"https://cdn.i-scmp.com/sites/default/files/d8/images/canvas/2024/04/17/9907bf9c-7404-45cf-8209-e9f3b268b655_d3c53ba7.jpg"} The volunteers had the opportunity to learn about Nepalese culture. Photos: Handout

Unique trip

“This tour was a unique blend of volunteering and tourism,” Shing noted. She is organising another physiotherapist trip later this year. In the future, she hopes to include other professions.

Through icebreakers and hikes with the young trekking guides, the Hongkongers learned about Nepal’s culture and made new friends.

Fu and Lee fondly recalled: “When we said our farewells, the girls presented us with traditional Nepalese wallets that contained some money as a blessing. It deeply touched our hearts.”

title: 22-year-old held for smuggling stolen phones to Nepal: Delhi police - Hindustan Times
description: 22-year-old held for smuggling stolen phones to Nepal: Delhi police  Hindustan Times
publisher.title: Hindustan Times
full_article:
A 22-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly smuggling stolen mobile phones from India to Nepal, Delhi Police officers aware of the matter said on Sunday. The suspect was arrested with 11 stolen phones from Nangal Raya, near Delhi Cantonment in southwest Delhi on Wednesday, they added. We have solved seven cases of mobile phone snatching and thefts after arresting the suspect, said police officers. (Representational image)

His interrogation revealed that he had smuggled thousands of mobile phones, stolen mostly from Delhi and other states, into Nepal, said officers. The phones stolen from Delhi-National Capital Region (NCR) and other states are sold in Nepal and other neighbouring countries as used phones because they cannot be tracked outside India, police said.

HT launches Crick-it, a one stop destination to catch Cricket, anytime, anywhere. Explore now!

“The suspect, identified as Rohan Kumar from Nangal Raya, used to procure stolen phones from various receivers of stolen mobile phones active in various parts of Delhi and smuggled them to Nepal. This is a new trend that people involved in the sale and purchase of stolen phones have adopted to avoid getting caught by Indian law enforcement agencies and earn quick and easy money,” said a senior police officer aware of the arrest and disclosure of Rohan.

Deputy commissioner of police (southwest) Rohit Meena said that the arrest of Rohan came following efforts made by the anti-snatching cell of the southwest police district that was tasked to curb incidents of mobile phone snatching and thefts in the city. The team was asked to specifically focus on people who received stolen phones from thieves, snatchers, and robbers, and further sold them to their clients.

“On April 17, the team received information about a person who was involved in receiving and smuggling of stolen phones. It was learnt that the suspect would come near the crematorium at Nangal Raya in Delhi Cantonment. Accordingly, a trap was laid and the suspect, Rohan Kumar, was arrested,” said DCP Meena. He was in possession of five stolen phones. His interrogation led to the recovery of six more stolen phones that he had kept at his hideout,” added Meena.

During the interrogation, the DCP said, Rohan disclosed that he purchased stolen mobile phones from dealers/thieves and sold them in Nepal. “Hanny, Dilbag, and Sunny are his associates in this syndicate. They are at large. We have solved seven cases of mobile phone snatching and thefts after arresting Rohan,” he said.
translated: रविदिन दिल्ली के पुलिस अधिकारी के एहि मामला के बारे मे जानकारी के जानकारी के बारे मे जानकारी के बारे मे जानकारी के बारे मे कहल गेल अछि जे भारत सं नेपाल के चोरी के मोबाइल फोन के तस्करी करय के आरोप मे 22 वर्षीय युवक के गिरफ्तार कायल गेल अछि.बुधदिन दक्षिण पश्चिम दिल्ली के दिल्ली छावनी के पास नांगल राया सं 11 चोरी के फोन के संग संदिग्ध के गिरफ्तार कायल गेल अछि.पुलिस अधिकारी सब कहलनि जे, हम संदिग्ध के गिरफ्तार करय के बाद मोबाइल फोन छीनय के सात मामला के समाधान केलहुं अछि।(प्रतिनिधि छवि) हुनकऽ पूछताछ स॑ पता चललै कि हुनी नेपाल म॑ कहलकै कि हुनी हजारों मोबाइल फोन, जेकरा म॑ अधिकतर दिल्ली आरू अन्य राज्यऽ स॑ चोरी होय गेलऽ छेलै, न॑ नेपाल म॑ कहलकै ।पुलिस के कहनाय अछि जे दिल्ली-नेशनल कैपिटल रीजन (एनसीआर) आओर अन्य राज्य सं चोरी भेल फोन नेपाल आओर पड़ोसी देश के अन्य देश मे इस्तेमाल कएल गेल फोन के रूप मे बेचल जाएत अछि किएक त ओकरा भारत सं बाहर ट्रैक नहि कएल जा सकैत अछि.एचटी क्रिक-इट, क्रिकेट पकड़ै लेली एक स्टॉप गंतव्य, कहीं भी, लॉन्च करै छै ।आब अन्वेषण करू!“नांगल राया केरऽ रोहन कुमार के रूप म॑ पहचानलऽ जाय वाला संदिग्ध दिल्ली केरऽ विभिन्न भागऽ म॑ सक्रिय चोरी के मोबाइल फोनऽ के विभिन्न रिसीवरऽ स॑ चोरी के फोन खरीदै छेलै आरू ओकरा नेपाल के तस्करी करी क॑ ओकरा तस्करी करी दै छेलै ।ई एगो नया ट्रेंड छै जेकरा चोरी के फोन के बिक्री आरू खरीद म॑ शामिल लोगऽ न॑ भारतीय कानून प्रवर्तन एजेंसी सिनी द्वारा फंसै स॑ बचै आरू त्वरित आरू आसान पैसा अर्जित करै स॑ बचै लेली अपनान॑ छै,’’ रोहन के गिरफ्तारी आरू खुलासा के बारे म॑ जानकारी एगो वरिष्ठ पुलिस अधिकारी न॑ कहलकै ।पुलिस उपायुक्त (दक्षिण पश्चिम) रोहित मीना न॑ कहलकै कि दक्षिण पश्चिम पुलिस जिला केरऽ स्नैचिंग सेल केरऽ प्रयास के बाद रोहन केरऽ गिरफ्तारी ऐला के बाद आबै छै जेकरा प॑ मोबाइल फोन छीनी क॑ शहर म॑ चोरी के घटना प॑ लगाम लगाबै के काम देलऽ गेलऽ छै ।टीम स॑ कहलऽ गेलऽ छेलै कि विशेष रूप स॑ चोरी, स्नैचर, आरू डकैतऽ स॑ चोरी के फोन लेन॑ वाला लोगऽ प॑ ध्यान केंद्रित करलऽ जाय, आरू ओकरा आरू अपनऽ ग्राहकऽ क॑ आरू बेची देलऽ जाय ।“17 अप्रैल क॑ टीम क॑ चोरी के फोन क॑ प्राप्त करै आरू तस्करी करै म॑ शामिल व्यक्ति के बारे म॑ जानकारी मिललै ।पता चलल जे दिल्ली छावनी के नांगल राया स्थित शवदाह गृह के पास आबि जायत।तदनुसार एकटा जाल बिछाओल गेल आ संदिग्ध रोहन कुमार के गिरफ्तार क लेल गेल।'' डीसीपी मीना कहलनि।हुनका लग पाँचटा चोरीक फोन छलनि।हुनकऽ पूछताछ के वजह स॑ छह आरू चोरी के फोन ठीक होय गेलै जेकरा हुनी अपनऽ छिपलऽ प॑ रखन॑ छेलै,’’ मीना न॑ आरू कहलकै ।डीसीपी के कहनाय छनि जे पूछताछ के दौरान रोहन खुलासा केलनि जे ओ डीलर/थाईव सं चोरी के मोबाइल फोन खरीदि नेपाल मे बेचि देलथि.“हैनी, डिलबाग, आ सनी एहि सिन्डिकेट मे हुनकर सहयोगी छथि ।ओ सभ मोटा-मोटी अछि।हम रोहन के गिरफ्तार करला के बाद मोबाइल फोन के स्नैचिंग आ चोरी के सात मामला के समाधान केने छी।'
label: EduTech

title: Avalanche triggers overflow in Nepal’s Birendra lake - The Tribune India
description: Avalanche triggers overflow in Nepal’s Birendra lake  The Tribune India
publisher.title: The Tribune India
full_article:
PTI

Kathmandu, April 21

A massive avalanche descended from the slopes of Mt Manaslu on Sunday morning, cascading into Birendra Lake situated below the peak in northern Nepal, triggering its overflow.

There is no report of any damage or casuality as the site is situated away from human settlement, officials said.

However, the resultant surge has led to a significant rise in the water levels of the river, Home Ministry spokesperson Narayan Prasad Bhattarai said.

The Home Ministry has issued a precautionary notice to residents living near downstream areas of the river.

Join Whatsapp Channel of The Tribune for latest updates.

#Nepal
translated: पीटीआई काठमांडू, 21 अप्रैल रविदिन भोरे माउंट मनस्लू के ढलान स एकटा विशाल हिमस्खलन उतरल, उत्तरी नेपाल के चोटी के नीचा स्थित बिरेन्द्र झील में झरना, अपन ओवरफ्लो के ट्रिगर केलक.अधिकारि सब कहलनि जे, एहि ठाम मानव बस्ती सं दूर स्थित कोनो नुकसान या कैविजिटी के कोनो रिपोर्ट नहिं अछि।लेकिन एकरऽ परिणामस्वरूप उछाल के कारण नदी केरऽ जल स्तर म॑ काफी बढ़ोत्तरी होय गेलऽ छै ।गृह मंत्रालय नदी के डाउनस्ट्रीम इलाका के पास रहय वाला निवासी के एहतियात के नोटिस जारी केलक अछि.नवीनतम अपडेट के लेल ट्रिब्यून के व्हाट्सएप चैनल के जुड़ू.#नेपाल 2019।
label: EduTech

title: Over 230 homes, animal sheds gutted in multiple fires across western Nepal since Saturday - The Kathmandu Post
description: Over 230 homes, animal sheds gutted in multiple fires across western Nepal since Saturday  The Kathmandu Post
publisher.title: The Kathmandu Post
full_article:
Over the past two days, a spate of fires—both house fires and forest fires—have wreaked havoc in various districts. An elderly woman died in Rukum West while more than 230 houses and animal sheds were destroyed in Gulmi, Arghakhanchi, Rupandehi and Saptari districts, destroying property worth millions of rupees.



Seventy-year-old Budi Kami was burnt to death while she attempted to protect her house from forest fire in Nipane village in ward 3 of Baphikot Rural Municipality in Rukum West on Sunday. According to Janak Kumar Batha, chairman of Baphikot Rural Municipality, the incident happened as the victim attempted to control forest fire by destroying her house.

The forest fire entered the settlement and destroyed four houses including that of Budi Kami. Batha said the houses of Yuvaraj BK, Ananta BK and Dhan Bahadur Bohara were destroyed by the forest fire. “Security personnel have been deployed in the affected area to control the fires. Efforts are on, with the assistance of locals, to control fires from spreading and save lives and property,” said Bishnu Prasad Shrestha, Police Inspector at the District Police Office in Rukum West. The fires destroyed scores of hectares of forest land in several forests in the district.

After forest fires entered human settlements in Gulmi, around 89 houses and animal sheds were completely destroyed on Saturday. Ishma, Madane, Malika, Gulmi Durbar Rurukshetra, and Chhatrakot Dhurkot rural municipalities and Musikot Municipality of the district are affected by fire.

According to Deputy Superintendent of Police Shankar Pokhrel of the Gulmi District Police Office, two people were injured, while 83 domesticated animals were killed and nine were injured in the fires. Similarly, two rice mills, a tractor, two shops, and a temple, were also destroyed in the district.

The injured were two male residents of Ishma-1 and Musikot-1.

The fire destroyed 27 houses, 33 sheds, a tractor, two rice mills, and two shops in different wards of Ishma Rural Municipality, whereas a couple of houses were destroyed in other local units, said Pokhrel.

“Complete details of the damage caused by the fires are yet to come,” Pokhrel added.

On Saturday night, all the victims were living under the open sky. Only on Sunday did the Nepal Red Cross Society provide assistance in some areas, whereas other victims still have not received any relief.

Ishma Rural Municipality, the most affected local unit, has announced that it will provide a month’s salary of the people's representatives and five percent of the monthly salary of the employees to the fire relief fund to help the rescue and relief efforts.

According to the District Police Office, forest fires in a few places have come under control, but they have not been able to control the fires in eight other places.

Rajan Kunwar, information officer at the Division Forest Office, Gulmi, said that around eight hectares of forest have been destroyed by fire in two days.

“People in rural areas still burn hay in their fields and near their houses for planting new crops and for fertiliser, and such activities have contributed to the spread of fires. Due to a lack of awareness in remote areas, and a lack of strict laws, people knowingly and inadvertently start forest fires,” said Kuwar. “The federal and other agencies conduct awareness programmes in the district headquarters, but these have not been effective. Such awareness efforts usually fail to reach the local residents living away from the district headquarters,” Kunwar added.

In Rupandehi, around 50 houses in separate incidents of fire in Rohini and Gaidahawa rural municipalities on Saturday.

A fire, which was started to burn wheat stalks, quickly spread to settlements and destroyed 50 houses at ward 4, 5 and 6 of the Rohini Municipality. Many of the houses were burnt to a cinder while several more suffered partial damage in the inferno.

Fanned by winds, the fire engulfed the settlement in no time and the locals could not salvage their belongings. According to Bidhya Prasad Yadav, the rural municipality chief, the fire destroyed property worth more than Rs10 million. Security personnel from the Nepal Army, Nepal Police, and Armed Police Force, and local residents brought the fire under control after a few hours. The rural municipality on Sunday distributed relief materials and Rs3,000 cash to each affected family as immediate relief.

Likewise, a fire destroyed a thatch-roof house belonging to Balemindra Lodha in ward 7 of Gaidahawa on Saturday. Police said nine goats were also killed in the incident.

In Arghakhanchi, as many as 43 houses and sheds were destroyed in various incidents of fires on Saturday. According to Police Inspector Dipendra Rawal of the District Police Office in Arghakhanchi, 20 houses and 23 sheds were destroyed in the district.

Thirteen houses and 10 animal sheds were gutted in Dharapani village of Bhumikasthan Rural Municipality while five houses and eight sheds were burnt to ashes in Shitganga Municipality in the district.

On the same day, two houses and five sheds in Panini Rural Municipality were also destroyed by a fire.

Fires are continuing unchecked in several districts of Lumbini Province this year. According to Dilaram Paudel, the information officer at the provincial Ministry of Forest, Environment, Tourism and Drinking Water, the fire incidents occurred in more than 300 places in the province this year. A total of 11,448 hectares of forests have been affected by the wildfires.

“Gulmi is the hardest hit by fire, mainly forest fires. Several incidents of fire have been reported in Kapilvastu, Arghakhanchi, Palpa, Pyuthan, Bardiya and Rupandehi districts. We are assessing the damage caused,” said Paudel.

As per the data available at Provincial Police Office in Lumbini, a total of 25 people including six children died in fire incidents in the current fiscal year of 2023-24.

In Saptari, a total of 24 houses were burnt to ashes in a Dalit settlement in ward 5 of Kanchanrup Municipality on Sunday. The fire started from a hearth in a shed belonging to Lalmohan Sardar at around 3pm.

According to Deputy Superintendent of Police Dhundiraj Neupane, 24 tin-roof houses of 12 families were destroyed in the inferno. Preliminary police investigation has put the property losses at around Rs 2.4 million. Security personnel and local residents aided by three fire engines brought the inferno under control after an hour and a half.
translated: पिछला दू दिन मे आगि लगबाक एकटा बाढ़ि-घर मे आगि आ जंगलक आगि-विभिन्न जिला मे तबाही मचौने अछि।रूकुम वेस्ट में एकटा बुजुर्ग महिला के मृत्यु भ गेलैन जखन कि 230 सं बेसी घर आ जानवरक शेड के गुलमी, अरगाखाची, रूपंडेही आ सप्तरी जिला में नष्ट क देल गेलैन, जे लाखों रुपया के संपत्ति के नष्ट क देलखिन।रविदिन रूकुम वेस्ट के बाफीकोट ग्रामीण नगरपालिका के वार्ड 3 के निपान विलेज में निपान गाम में अपन घर के जंगल सं बचाबय के कोशिश के दौरान सत्तर साल के बुडी कामी के मौत भ गेल छल.बाफीकोट ग्रामीण नगरपालिका के अध्यक्ष जनक कुमार बथा के अनुसार ई घटना घटला के कारण भेल छल जखन पीड़िता अपन घर के नष्ट क वन में आगि पर काबू करय के कोशिश केलक।जंगली आगि बस्ती मे प्रवेश केलक आ बुडी कामी सहित चारि टा घर नष्ट क देलक।बथा कहलनि जे, युवाराज बीके, अनंत बीके आ धन बहादुर बोरा के घर जंगल मे आगि लगला सं नष्ट भ गेल।“आगि क॑ नियंत्रित करै लेली प्रभावित क्षेत्र म॑ सुरक्षाकर्मी क॑ तैनात करलऽ गेलऽ छै ।स्थानीय लोगऽ के सहायता स॑, फैलाबै आरू जीवन आरू संपत्ति के बचाबै स॑ आगऽ क॑ नियंत्रित करै के प्रयास करलऽ जाय छै,’’ रूकुम वेस्ट केरऽ जिला पुलिस कार्यालय केरऽ पुलिस निरीक्षक बिष्णु प्रसाद श्रेस्थ न॑ कहलकै ।आगि स जिला क कईटा जंगल मे हेक्टेयर क हिस्सा वन भूमि क नष्ट भ गेल।गुलमी में जंगल में आगि लगला के बाद शनिदिन लगभग 89 घर आ जानवर के शेड के पूरा तरह सं नष्ट भ गेल छल.इशमा, मदर, मलिका, गुलमी दरबार रुरुक्षेत्रा, आ छत्राकोट धुर्कोत ग्रामीण नगरपालिका आ म्यूसिकोट नगरपालिका के जिला अग्नि स प्रभावित अछि।गुल्मी जिला पुलिस कार्यालय के पुलिस के उप-अधीक्षक शंकर पोखरेल के अनुसार, दू गोटे घायल भ गेल, जखन कि 83 पालतू जानवर के मौत भ गेल आ आगि में नौ गोटे घायल भ गेल।तहिना जिला मे दू टा चाउर मिल, ट्रैक्टर, दू टा दोकान आ एकटा मंदिर सेहो नष्ट भ गेल।घायल इशमा-1 आ म्यूसिकोट-1 के दू टा पुरुष निवासी छल।पोखरेल कहलनि जे एहि आगि मे इशमा ग्रामीण नगरपालिका के अलग-अलग वार्ड मे 27 घर, 33 शेड, एकटा ट्रैक्टर, दू टा चाउर मिल, आ दू टा दोकान के नष्ट भ गेल, जखन कि अन्य स्थानीय इकाइ मे एक दू टा घर नष्ट भ गेल।पोखरेल आगू कहलनि जे, आगि लगला सं भेल नुकसान के पूरा विवरण एखन धरि नहि अछि।शनि दिन राति मे सब पीड़ित खुला आकाश मे रहैत छल।नेपाल रेड क्रॉस सोसाइटी किछु क्षेत्र मे सहायता देलक, जखन कि अन्य पीड़ित कए एखनो कोनो राहत नहि भेटल अछि।इशमा ग्रामीण नगरपालिका, जे सबसें प्रभावित स्थानीय इकाई छै, न॑ घोषणा करलकै कि वू लोगऽ के प्रतिनिधियऽ के एक महीना के वेतन आरू कर्मचारी सिनी के मासिक वेतन के पांच प्रतिशत के वेतन के अनुमति देतै जेकरा स॑ बचाव आरू राहत के प्रयास म॑ मदद मिल॑ सक॑ ।जिला पुलिस कार्यालय के अनुसार किछ जगह पर जंगल में आगि काबू में आबि गेल अछि, मुदा ओ सब आठ ठाम आगि पर काबू नहिं क सकल अछि.डिवीजन वन कार्यालय के सूचना अधिकारी गुलमी के कहनाय छनि जे दू दिन मे आगि सं करीब आठ हेक्टेयर जंगल के नष्ट भ गेल अछि.“ग्राणी क्षेत्रऽ म॑ लोगऽ न॑ अखनी भी अपनऽ खेतऽ म॑ आरू अपनऽ घरऽ के पास नया फसल आरू खाद के लेलऽ अपनऽ घरऽ के पास जलाबै छै, आरू ऐन्हऽ गतिविधियऽ के योगदान स॑ आग के फैलाव म॑ योगदान छै ।दूरस्थ क्षेत्रऽ म॑ जागरूकता के कमी के कारण, आरू सख्त कानून के कमी के कारण, लोगऽ क॑ जानबूझ क॑ आरू अनजाने म॑ जंगलऽ के आगी शुरू होय जाय छै,’’ कुवर न॑ कहलकै ।“संघीय आरू अन्य एजेंसी जिला मुख्यालय म॑ जागरूकता कार्यक्रम संचालित करै छै, लेकिन ई सब प्रभावी नै रहलऽ छै ।ऐन्हऽ जागरूकता प्रयास आमतौर प॑ जिला मुख्यालय स॑ दूर रहै वाला स्थानीय निवासी सिनी तलक पहुँचै म॑ विफल छै ।’’ कुनवार न॑ आरू कहलकै ।रूपन्डेही मे रोहिनी आ गैदाहावा ग्रामीण नगरपालिका मे शनिदिन अलग-अलग आग लगबाक अलग-अलग घटना मे लगभग 50 घर।गहूम के डाँट जलाबय के काज शुरू भ गेल छल, जल्दी सं बस्ती में पसरल आ रोहिनी नगरपालिका के वार्ड 4, 5 आ 6 में 50 घर के नष्ट क देलक.बहुत रास घर सिन्डर के जरा देल गेल जखन कि कतेको आओर के इंफर्नो मे आंशिक नुकसान भेल.हवा सॅं पंखा लगा क ’ आगि किछुए काल मे बस्तीक घेराबंदी केलक आ स्थानीय लोक अपन सामानक उद्धरण नहि क ’ सकल ।ग्रामीण नगरपालिका प्रमुख बिधाया प्रसाद यादव के अनुसार आगि लगला स एक करोड़ स बेसी क संपत्ति कए नष्ट क देल गेल।नेपाल सेना, नेपाल पुलिस, आ सशस्त्र पुलिस बल के सुरक्षाकर्मी आ स्थानीय निवासी किछु घंटा के बाद आगि के नियंत्रण में आनि देलक।ग्रामीण नगरपालिका रविदिन राहत सामग्री आ प्रत्येक प्रभावित परिवार के 3,000 रुपया नकदी के तत्काल राहत के रूप में वितरित केलक।तहिना एकटा आगि शनिदिन गैदाहावाक वार्ड 7 मे बलेमिन्द्र लोधाक फीच-छुपाक घर केँ नष्ट क देलक।पुलिस के कहनाय अछि जे एहि घटना मे नौ बकरी के मौत सेहो भेल अछि.अरघखान्ची मे शनिदिन आगि के विभिन्न घटना मे 43 घर आ शेड के नष्ट भ गेल।अरगाखान्ची स्थित जिला पुलिस कार्यालय के पुलिस निरीक्षक डिपेंद्रा रावल के अनुसार जिला में 20 घर आ 23 शेड के नष्ट क देल गेल अछि।तेरह घर आ 10 जानवरक शेडक आंत भुमिकास्थान ग्रामीण नगरपालिकाक धरपानी गाम मे भेल छल जखन कि जिलाक शित्गंगा नगरपालिका मे राखक लेल पाँच घर आ आठ शेड जलाओल गेल छल |ओही दिन पाणिनी ग्रामीण नगरपालिका मे दू टा घर आ पाँच शेड सेहो आगि सँ नष्ट भ गेल।एहि साल लुम्बिनी प्रांत क कईटा जिला मे आगि लगाउल गेल अछि।प्रांतीय वन, पर्यावरण, पर्यटन आरू पेयजल मंत्रालय केरऽ सूचना अधिकारी दिलाराम पौडेल के अनुसार ई साल प्रांत केरऽ ३०० स॑ भी अधिक जगहऽ प॑ आग के घटना घटलै ।जंगली आगि स कुल 11,448 हेक्टेयर जंगल प्रभावित भेल अछि।“गल्मी मे आगि लगला सँ सबसँ बेसी मारल जाइत अछि, मुख्यतः जंगल मे आगि।कपिलवास्तु, अरघखान्ची, पाल्पा, प्युथन, बरदिया आ रुपांडेही जिला मे आगि लगबाक कतेको घटनाक सूचना भेटल अछि ।हम भेल नुकसान क आकलन क रहल छी।Ó पौडेल कहला।लुम्बिनी केरऽ प्रांतीय पुलिस कार्यालय म॑ उपलब्ध आंकड़ा के अनुसार २०२३-२४ केरऽ चालू वित्तीय वर्ष म॑ आग के घटना म॑ छह बच्चा सहित कुल २५ लोगऽ के मौत होय गेलऽ छै ।सप्टारी मे रविदिन कानचारुप नगरपालिका के वार्ड 5 मे दलित बस्ती मे कुल 24 घर जरि गेल।ललमहान सरदार के लगभग 3 बजे एकटा शेड में एकटा चूल्हा सं आगि लागल छल.पुलिस के उप-अधीक्षक धुन्दिराज न्यूउपेन के अनुसार, 24 टीन छत के घर 12 परिवार के घर के नरक में नष्ट क देल गेल छल।प्रारंभिक पुलिस जांच मे संपत्ति के नुकसान के करीब 24 लाख रुपया आबि गेल अछि.सुरक्षा कर्मी आ स्थानीय निवासी तीन टा फायर इंजन के सहायता सं डेढ़ घंटा के बाद इंफर्नो के नियंत्रण में आबि गेल.

title: Bipin Joshi's release will be on agenda during Qatari Emir's Nepal visit: PM Dahal - The Kathmandu Post
description: Bipin Joshi's release will be on agenda during Qatari Emir's Nepal visit: PM Dahal  The Kathmandu Post
publisher.title: The Kathmandu Post
full_article:
The agenda of the release of Bipin Joshi, the Nepali student who has been in Palestinian militant group Hamas’s captivity since October 7, will figure during the upcoming Nepal visit of the Emir of the State of Qatar Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al-Thani, Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal said on Sunday.



While addressing the fourth convocation ceremony of the far-west university on Sunday, Prime Minister Dahal, who is also the chancellor of the University, said that the government has made necessary diplomatic efforts for Joshi’s release.

Joshi was abducted when Hamas attacked Israel on October 7, 2023. Ten Nepali students were killed in the armed attack.

Over 49 students of Sudurpaschim University studying in the faculty of agriculture science had gone to Israel under the ‘Learn and Earn’ programme just a month before the attack. All other students, except for Joshi, were repatriated soon after the attack.

Since then, Joshi’s family members have been pleading with the government for his safe release.

“The incident where our students who were working in Israel under the ‘Learn and Earn’ programme has saddened us all,” Prime Minister Dahal said while addressing the convocation ceremony.

Dahal added that the role that Qatar can play in helping release Joshi will be an agenda during the Emir’s visit. Qatari Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al-Thani is arriving in Kathmandu on Tuesday on a two-day state visit, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced in a press release on Sunday. This will be the first highest-level visit to Nepal from the Emir of the Gulf country since the two sides established diplomatic relations in 1977.

The Emir’s visit will hold special significance in terms of Joshi’s release since Qatar has been playing the role of a mediator between Israel and Hamas after October 7. Qatar helped broker a brief ceasefire deal between the two parties in November and release over 100 hostages held by the militant group. Hamas has its political office in Doha, the Qatari capital.

While in Nepal, Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al-Thani will hold bilateral talks with Prime Minister Dahal on Wednesday. The two countries are also expected to sign about nine agreements during the visit.

Qatar, a high-income country which is among the major labour destinations for Nepalis, is looking to invest in some big projects in Nepal.
translated: 7 अक्टूबर स फिलिस्तीनी उग्रवादी समूह हमास के कैद में रहल नेपाली के छात्र बिपिन जोशी के रिलीज के एजेंडा, कतार शेख तमिम बिन अल-थनी राज्य के अमीर के आगामी नेपाल के दौरा के दौरान आंकड़ा के आंकड़ा देत, प्रधानमंत्री, प्रधानमंत्री के प्रधानमंत्री पुष्पा कमल दहल रविदिन कहलनि।रविवार क॑ दूर-पश्चिम विश्वविद्यालय केरऽ चारिम दीक्षांत समारोह क॑ संबोधित करतें हुअ॑ प्रधानमंत्री दहल न॑ विश्वविद्यालय केरऽ कुलपति भी छै, न॑ कहलकै कि सरकार न॑ जोशी केरऽ रिलीज लेली आवश्यक कूटनीतिक प्रयास करलकै ।जोशी केरऽ अपहरण करलऽ गेलै जब॑ हमास न॑ ७ अक्टूबर २०२३ क॑ इजरायल प॑ हमला करलकै ।सशस्त्र हमला म॑ दस नेपाली छात्रऽ के मौत होय गेलै ।कृषि विज्ञान संकाय म॑ अध्ययन करै वाला सूदुरपचिम विश्वविद्यालय केरऽ 49 स॑ अधिक छात्र हमला स॑ महज एक महीना पहलें ‘लर्न आरू अर्जित’ कार्यक्रम के तहत इजरायल गेलऽ छेलै ।जोशी के छोड़ि क बाकी सब छात्र के हमला के तुरंत बाद वापस क देल गेल।तहिया सं जोशी के परिवार के सदस्य सरकार सं हुनकर सुरक्षित रिलीज के गुहार लगा रहल छथिन्ह.प्रधानमंत्री दाहल नँ दीखन समारोह के संबोधित करतें हुअय कहलकै, “ई घटना जहाँ हमरौ छात्र जे ‘लर्न आरू अर्जित' कार्यक्रम के तहत इजरायल मँ काम करी रहलौ छेलै, ओकरा स॑ हमरा सब क॑ दुखी होय गेलऽ छै ।दाहल न॑ आरू कहलकै कि कतार क॑ जे भूमिका जोशी क॑ रिलीज करै म॑ मदद करै म॑ निभा सकै छै, वू अमीर केरऽ यात्रा के दौरान एगो एजेंडा बनतै ।विदेश मंत्रालय केरऽ घोषणा म॑ रविवार क॑ एगो प्रेस विज्ञप्ति जारी करी क॑ मंगलवार क॑ काठमांडू पहुँची क॑ काठमांडू पहुँची रहलऽ छै ।1977 मे दुनू पक्षक कूटनीतिक संबंध स्थापित करबाक बाद खाड़ी देशक अमीर सँ नेपाल केर ई पहिल सर्वोच्च स्तरक यात्रा होयत।जशी केर रिलीज केर मामला मे अमीर केर एहि यात्राक विशेष महत्व रहत, कारण कतार एकटा मध्यस्थक भूमिका निभा रहल अछि। 7 अक्टूबर के बाद इजरायल आरू हमास के बीच.कतार नवंबर म॑ दूनू पार्टी के बीच एगो संक्षिप्त युद्धविराम सौदा के ब्रोकर म॑ मदद करलकै आरू उग्रवादी समूह द्वारा आयोजित 100 स॑ अधिक बंधक क॑ रिहा करै म॑ मदद करलकै ।हमास केरऽ राजनीतिक पद कतारी केरऽ राजधानी दोहा म॑ छै ।नेपाल मे रहैत अमीर शेख तमिम बिन हमद अल-थानी बुधदिन प्रधानमंत्री दहल के संग द्विपक्षीय वार्ता करताह।ई दूनू देशऽ क॑ ई यात्रा के दौरान लगभग नौ समझौता प॑ हस्ताक्षर करै के उम्मीद छै ।उच्च आय वाला देश जे नेपालिस केरऽ प्रमुख श्रम गंतव्यऽ म॑ शामिल छै, कतर नेपाल केरऽ कुछ बड़ऽ परियोजना म॑ निवेश करै के कोशिश करी रहलऽ छै ।

title: India stops tea-laden Nepali trucks on border for lab tests - The Kathmandu Post
description: India stops tea-laden Nepali trucks on border for lab tests  The Kathmandu Post
publisher.title: The Kathmandu Post
full_article:
As India has asked its customs authorities to test the quality of India-bound Nepali tea, trucks laden with tonnes of tea destined for the southern neighbour are currently stuck at the Panitanki Customs across the Nepal-India border.



Nepali traders say India’s Commerce Ministry recently issued a circular to its customs offices to test the quality of all tea imports from Nepal.

In 2005 and 2015, the Commerce Ministry of India had issued a similar circular to its customs to conduct mandatory lab tests on Nepali tea.

“Since then, Indian customs had been randomly sampling 5-20 percent of Nepali tea,” said Eshwor Raj Poudel, consul general of Nepal to Kolkata, India. “But this time the Indian government ordered sampling every single batch, or 100 percent, of tea before exporting to India. The new circular has created problems,” he said.

Citing the circular, Poudel said, the southern neighbour has directed its customs to allow Nepali tea only after a negative report for toxins.

A few weeks ago, a lab test report of tea exported from Ilam to India came with a positive result for toxins, which has caused a problem in the export of Nepali tea to India, Poudel said.

“If the lab report of the new sample comes positive, it will give an easy excuse for India to stop the import of Nepali tea,” Poudel said.

Nepali tea samples are tested at the National Food Laboratory, Kolkata, India.

It takes 15 days for the results, which is likely to increase the cost of Nepali tea.

“We are compelled to park the tea-laden trucks on the road until the report comes. The tea can get damaged if it is held for a longer time,” said Roshan Agrawal, a customs agent. “There are no well-managed customs on the Indian side due to which we are forced to wait for the report by parking the trucks on the road.”

Poudel said that he has informed the Nepali Embassy in New Delhi and the Foreign, Agriculture and Industry and Commerce ministries about the issue. He said he also informed the Indian Embassy in Nepal about the problem.

“We have asked the Indian authorities to stick with the existing circular and not to enforce the new one,” Poudel said. “As the issue is related to public health, we don’t know how India will take our request,” he said.

Around 92 percent of Nepal-produced tea is exported to India through the eastern border point while 6 percent is exported from Biratnagar and 2 percent from Birgunj.

Some traders suspect geopolitics may be behind the new “hassles”. Recently, there have been reports that Nepal has been exploring alternative markets like China and Pakistan—two arch rivals of India—to export its tea.

Officials from Pakistan and China have been visiting Nepal to study tea and to potentially look for long-term supply agreements, according to the sources privy to the matter.

Nepal’s tea exports declined by 11.82 percent in the first eight months of the current fiscal year compared to the same period last fiscal year, customs data show.

Nepal exported 9,823 tonnes of tea—both orthodox and CTC—worth Rs2.46 billion during the review period.

Demand for Nepali tea has been rising as the bushes in Darjeeling have aged. Therefore, the Nepali tea leaves were a valuable input for the factories in and around Darjeeling, traders said.

For years, Indian buyers have been alleging that Nepal’s tea is substandard and, as a result, offering lower prices. Nepali tea is often stopped at different border points under various pretexts.

In June 2022, India’s Parliamentary Standing Committee on Commerce asked the Indian government to apply stringent requirements for the certificate of origin on tea imported from Nepal.

The committee had said the entry of low-quality products from neighboring countries was jeopardising the Indian tea industry and called for the imposition of anti-dumping duty ranging from 40-100 percent. The panel had also called for a review of the Indo-Nepal Treaty of 1950.



In 2018, 11 trucks carrying tea were stopped at the Indian customs at Panitanki for a week over quarantine issues. Again, in 2020, over a dozen trucks carrying Nepali tea were stranded on the bridge over the Mechi river for days.

The Darjeeling Tea Association, for a long time, had been requesting the Indian government to stop tea imports from Nepal.

The National Tea and Coffee Board has prepared draft guidelines, which are in the final stages of completion to give the CTC tea a quality trademark recognition. In September 2020, Nepal’s orthodox tea got its trademark, 157 years after the country started growing the herb.

The market for Nepali CTC tea is also gradually being expanded to other countries.
translated: जेना कि भारत अपनऽ सीमा शुल्क अधिकारियऽ स॑ भारत जाय वाला नेपाली चाय के गुणवत्ता के परीक्षण करै लेली कहल॑ छै, दक्षिणी पड़ोसी लेली नियति वाला टन चाय स॑ भरलऽ ट्रक न॑ नेपाल-इंडिया सीमा के पार पितणकी सीमा शुल्क प॑ फंसलऽ छै ।नेपाली व्यापारी के कहनाय छनि जे भारत के वाणिज्य मंत्रालय हाल मे नेपाल सं सभ चाय आयात के गुणवत्ता के परीक्षण करय लेल अपन सीमा शुल्क कार्यालय मे परिपत्र जारी केलक अछि.2005 आरू 2015 म॑ भारत केरऽ वाणिज्य मंत्रालय न॑ नेपाली चाय प॑ अनिवार्य लैब टेस्ट करै लेली अपनऽ सीमा शुल्क के समान गोलाकार जारी करल॑ छेलै ।नेपाल केरऽ महावाणिज्य जनरल क॑ भारत केरऽ कोलकाता स॑ महावाणिज्य जनरल एश्वर राज पौडेल न॑ कहलकै कि जब॑ स॑ भारतीय सीमा शुल्क न॑ नेपाली केरऽ चाय केरऽ ५-२० प्रतिशत के नमूना लेन॑ छेलै ।“मुदा एहि बेर भारत सरकार भारत मे निर्यात करबा स पहिने हर एक बैच यानी 100 प्रतिशत चाह क नमूना लेबाक आदेश देलक।नव परिपत्र समस्या पैदा केलक अछि।'पौडेल न॑ कहलकै कि परिपत्र के हवाला दैत॑ हुअ॑ दक्षिणी पड़ोसी न॑ अपनऽ सीमा शुल्क के निर्देशन करलकै कि विषाक्त पदार्थऽ के नकारात्मक रिपोर्ट के बाद ही नेपाली चाय के अनुमति देलऽ जाय ।पौडेल न॑ कहलकै कि कुछ हफ्ता पहलें इलाम स॑ भारत क॑ देलऽ गेलऽ चाय केरऽ लैब टेस्ट रिपोर्ट म॑ विषाक्त पदार्थऽ के सकारात्मक परिणाम आबी गेलऽ छेलै, जेकरा स॑ नेपाली चाय केरऽ भारत म॑ निर्यात म॑ समस्या पैदा होय गेलऽ छै ।पौडेल नँ कहलकै, “जदि नया नमूना के लैब रिपोर्ट सकारात्मक आबै छै त भारत क नेपाली चाय के आयात बंद करै के आसान बहाना मिलतै ।नेपाली चाय के नमूना के परीक्षण राष्ट्रीय खाद्य प्रयोगशाला, कोलकाता के भारत में करलऽ जाय छै ।परिणाम के लेल 15 दिन लगैत अछि, जाहि सं नेपाली चाय के लागत बढ़य के संभावना अछि.ओ कहला जे हम सब सड़क पर चाह स भरल ट्रक पार्क करबा लेल मजबूर छी जा धरि रिपोर्ट नहि आबि रहल अछि।चाह क॑ अधिक समय तलक रखलऽ जाय त॑ नुकसान पहुँची सकै छै ।’’ कस्टम एजेंट रोशन अग्रवाल न॑ कहलकै ।“भारतीय पक्ष मे कोनो नीक प्रबंधित रीति-रिवाज नहि अछि जकर कारण हम सब सड़क पर ट्रक पार्किंग कए रिपोर्ट क इंतजार करबा लेल मजबूर छी।”पौडेल न॑ कहलकै कि हुनी नई दिल्ली म॑ नेपाली दूतावास आरू विदेशी, कृषि आरू उद्योग आरू वाणिज्य मंत्रालयऽ क॑ ई मुद्दा के बारे म॑ जानकारी देल॑ छै ।ओ कहलनि जे, ओ नेपाल मे भारतीय दूतावास के सेहो एहि समस्या के बारे मे सूचित केलनि।पौडेल कहलनि जे, हम भारतीय अधिकारी सब स कहलहुं अछि जे ओ मौजूदा परिपत्र स चिपकल रहय आ नव के लागू नहि करय।ओ कहलनि जे, जेना-जेना ई मुद्दा जनस्वास्थ्य सं संबंधित अछि, हमरा सभ के पता नहि अछि जे भारत हमर सभक आग्रह कोना करत.नेपाल द्वारा निर्मित लगभग ९२ प्रतिशत चाय पूर्वी सीमा बिन्दु के माध्यम सँ भारत मे निर्यात कयल गेल अछि जखन कि ६ प्रतिशत बिरात्नगर सँ आ 2 प्रतिशत बिर्गुंज सँ निर्यात कयल गेल अछि |किछु व्यापारी के आशंका अछि जे नव “घृणा” के पाछू भू-राजनीति भ सकैत अछि.हाल ही म॑ ई खबर आबी रहलऽ छै कि नेपाल न॑ अपनऽ चाय के निर्यात करै लेली चीन आरू पाकिस्तान - भारत केरऽ दू आर्क प्रतिद्वंदी – जैसनऽ वैकल्पिक बाजारऽ के खोज करी रहलऽ छै ।पाकिस्तान आरू चीन के अधिकारी न॑ चाय के अध्ययन लेली आरू संभावित रूप स॑ दीर्घकालिक आपूर्ति समझौता के खोज करै लेली नेपाल के दौरा करी रहलऽ छै, ई मामला स॑ प्राइवी सूत्रऽ के अनुसार ।सीमा शुल्क केरऽ आंकड़ा बताबै छै कि पिछला वित्तीय वर्ष केरऽ समान अवधि के तुलना म॑ चालू वित्तीय वर्ष केरऽ पहलऽ आठ महीना म॑ नेपाल केरऽ चाय निर्यात म॑ ११.८२ प्रतिशत के गिरावट आबी गेलऽ छै ।नेपाल न॑ समीक्षा अवधि के दौरान 2.46 अरब रुपया केरऽ 9,823 टन चाय केरऽ निर्यात करलकै-रूढ़िवादी आरू सीटीसी दोनों के ।दार्जिलिंग में झाड़ी के उम्र बढ़ला सं नेपाली के चाह के मांग बढ़ि रहल अछि.अतः दार्जिलिंग आ आसपास के कारखाना के लेल नेपाली के चाय के पत्ता एकटा बहुमूल्य इनपुट छल, व्यापारी सब कहलनि।सालों स॑ भारतीय खरीदारऽ के आरोप लगैलऽ जाय रहलऽ छै कि नेपाल केरऽ चाय घटिया छै आरू एकरऽ परिणामस्वरूप कम दाम के पेशकश करै छै ।नेपाली चाय प्रायः विभिन्न बहावक नीचाँ विभिन्न सीमावर्ती बिन्दु पर रोकल जाइत अछि ।जून २०२२ म॑ भारत केरऽ वाणिज्य पर संसदीय स्थायी समिति न॑ भारत सरकार स॑ कहलकै कि नेपाल स॑ आयात करलऽ गेलऽ चाय प॑ मूल प्रमाणपत्र लेली कठोर आवश्यकता लागू करलऽ जाय ।समिति न॑ कहल॑ छेलै कि पड़ोसी देशऽ स॑ कम गुणवत्ता वाला उत्पादऽ के प्रवेश भारतीय चाय उद्योग क॑ खतरा म॑ डाल॑ रहलऽ छै आरू 40-100 प्रतिशत तलक के एंटी डंपिंग ड्यूटी लगाबै के आह्वान करै छै ।पैनल न॑ १९५० केरऽ इंडो-नेपाल संधि के समीक्षा के आह्वान भी करल॑ छेलै ।२०१८ म॑ क्वारंटाइन केरऽ मुद्दा प॑ पनिनकी म॑ भारतीय कस्टम म॑ चाय ले जाय वाला ११ ट्रक क॑ रोकलऽ गेलै ।पुनः 2020 में नेपाली चाह ल क एक दर्जन सं बेसी ट्रक मेची नदी पर पुल पर दिन भरि फंसल छल.दार्जिलिंग टी एसोसिएशन बहुत दिन स भारत सरकार स आग्रह क रहल छल जे ओ नेपाल स चाह क आयात बंद करि देत।नेशनल टी एंड कॉफी बोर्ड न॑ ड्राफ्ट गाइडलाइन तैयार करलकै, जे पूरा होय के अंतिम चरण म॑ छै ताकि सीटीसी चाय क॑ गुणवत्तापूर्ण ट्रेडमार्क पहचान मिल॑ सक॑ ।सितम्बर २०२० म॑ नेपाल केरऽ रूढ़िवादी चाय क॑ अपनऽ ट्रेडमार्क मिललै, जेकरऽ १५७ साल बाद देश केरऽ जड़ी-बूटी बढ़ै के काम शुरू होय गेलै ।नेपाली सीटीसी चाय के बाजार के सेहो धीरे-धीरे दोसर देश मे विस्तारित कएल जा रहल अछि.
label: Economy

title: Nepal, Bangladesh push for PTA to elevate bilateral trade - Fibre2fashion.com
description: Nepal, Bangladesh push for PTA to elevate bilateral trade  Fibre2fashion.com
publisher.title: Fibre2fashion.com
full_article:
Led by Tapan Kanti Ghosh from Bangladesh and Dinesh Kumar Ghimire from Nepal, both delegations included officials from relevant ministries and ambassadors.

Both the countries emphasised the urgency of finalising the Preferential Trade Agreement at the 7th Commerce Secretary Level Meeting in Kathmandu. The proposed PTA aims to bolster trade by facilitating duty-free access to each other's goods. Both parties agreed for the TNC to promptly finalise PTA text, the Rules of Origin, and the product lists.

The proposed PTA aims to bolster trade by facilitating duty-free or preferential access to each other’s goods even as both parties agreed for the Trade Negotiating Committee (TNC) to promptly finalise the PTA text, Rules of Origin, and product lists.

Acknowledging their robust bilateral relations, they discussed various aspects for strengthening trade and economic cooperation.

With both countries set to graduate from Least Developed Country (LDC) status by 2026, challenges regarding market access were deliberated upon even as collaboration was emphasised to address these challenges and enhance connectivity.

Recent developments in power sector cooperation were welcomed, with Bangladesh highlighting the need for a secure power supply and comprehensive investor protection.

Existing bilateral Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) related to agriculture and trade regulations were also reviewed, underscoring effective implementation to foster a favourable business environment.

A significant step towards cooperation was the agreement to sign a Customs Mutual Assistance Agreement (CMMA), facilitating customs-related data exchange, harmonising customs procedures and simplifying visa processes for Bangladeshi businesspersons were also discussed.

Fibre2Fashion News Desk (DR)
translated: बांग्लादेश केरऽ तपन कान्ती घोष आरू नेपाल केरऽ दिनेश कुमार घीमाइर के नेतृत्व म॑ दोनों प्रतिनिधिमंडल न॑ संबंधित मंत्रालय आरू राजदूतऽ के अधिकारियऽ क॑ शामिल करलकै ।दुनू देश काठमांडू मे 7म वाणिज्य सचिव स्तर पर बैसार मे तरजीही व्यापार समझौता के अंतिम रूप देबय के तात्कालिकता पर जोर देलक.प्रस्तावित पीटीए कें उद्देश्य एक दोसरा कें माल कें शुल्क मुक्त पहुंच कें सुविधा द क व्यापार कें बढ़ावा देनाय छै.दूनू पक्ष टीएनसी क॑ पीटीए टेक्स्ट, मूल नियम, आरू उत्पाद सूची क॑ तुरंत फाइनल करै लेली सहमत होय गेलै ।प्रस्तावित पीटीए कें उद्देश्य एक दोसरा कें वस्तुअक कें ड्यूटी-मुक्त या वरीयता कें सुविधा कें सुविधा प्रदान करयत व्यापार कें बढ़ावा देनाय छै, कियाकि दूनू पक्षक व्यापारिक वार्ता समिति (टीएनसी) कें लेल सहमत छै ताकि पीटीए पाठ, मूल नियमक, आ उत्पाद सूची कें तुरंत अंतिम रूप देल जा सकय.अपनऽ मजबूत द्विपक्षीय संबंधऽ क॑ स्वीकार करी क॑ व्यापार आरू आर्थिक सहयोग क॑ मजबूत करै लेली विभिन्न पहलू प॑ चर्चा करलकै ।2026 तलक दूनू देशक कें कम विकसित देश (एलडीसी) कें दर्जा सं स्नातक करय कें लेल सेट छै, बाजार कें पहुंच कें संबंध मे चुनौती कें बारे मे सेहो विचार-विमर्श कैल गेलय, कियाकि इ चुनौतियक कें संबोधित करय आ कनेक्टिविटी कें बढ़ावा कें लेल सहयोग पर जोर देल गेलय.बिजली क्षेत्र केरऽ सहयोग म॑ हाल केरऽ विकास के स्वागत करलऽ गेलै, जेकरा म॑ बांग्लादेश सुरक्षित बिजली आपूर्ति आरू व्यापक निवेशक संरक्षण के जरूरत प॑ प्रकाश डाललकै ।कृषि आरू व्यापार नियमऽ स॑ संबंधित मौजूदा द्विपक्षीय समझ (मौस) के समीक्षा भी करलऽ गेलऽ छेलै, जेकरा स॑ अनुकूल व्यवसायिक माहौल क॑ बढ़ावा दै लेली प्रभावी कार्यान्वयन क॑ रेखांकित करलऽ गेलऽ छेलै ।सहयोग के तरफ एगो महत्वपूर्ण कदम छेलै सीमा शुल्क स॑ संबंधित डाटा एक्सचेंज क॑ सुविधाजनक बनाबै, सीमा शुल्क प्रक्रिया क॑ सामंजस्य बनाबै आरू बांग्लादेशी व्यवसायी लेली वीजा प्रक्रिया क॑ सरल बनाबै के समझौता करै के समझौता ।Fibre2Fashion समाचार डेस्क (डीआर)
label: Economy

title: Hero MotoCorp Inaugurates New Assembly Facility In Nepal - carandbike
description: Hero MotoCorp Inaugurates New Assembly Facility In Nepal  carandbike
publisher.title: carandbike
full_article:
Hero MotoCorp has been present in Nepal since 2014 and now the company inaugurated its new assembly facility in Nawalparasi, with the aim of expanding its operations in the country rapidly. The new assembly facility will have a capacity of 75,000 units per annum and also focus on bringing in new investment and creating job opportunities in the region. For this, Hero MotoCorp has partnered with CG Motors, who is the authorised distributor and will also work on expanding the sales and service network in the country.

Also Read: Hero MotoCorp Sees 5.6 Per Cent Drop In March 2024 Sales

Commenting on the collaboration, Sanjay Bhan, Chief Business Officer - Global Business Unit, Hero MotoCorp said, “With innovation and technology at its core, Hero MotoCorp is committed to providing world-class products and experiences to its customers across the globe. This is an exciting development for us, CG Motors and for Nepal. The state-of-the-art assembly unit will ensure that our world-class products will now be made in Nepal and available to customers across the country. The rapid expansion of the sales and service network will enable us to entrench the market with our world-class products and services. Our renewed focus in Nepal, along with our partners CG Motors, is reflective of our commitment to the country, which continues to be a very important market for us.”

Also Read: Hero Mavrick 440 Scrambler Name Trademarked

Hero MotoCorp will assemble four of its most popular models - Xpulse 200 4V, Super Splendor, Splendor+ motorcycles and Xoom 110 scooter at the new plant in Nepal. CG Motors has opened the flagship showroom in Kathmandu and aims to have over 100 sales and service outlets within the next three months.
translated: हीरो मोटोकॉर्प नेपाल म॑ २०१४ स॑ मौजूद छै आरू अब॑ कंपनी न॑ नवालपारासी म॑ अपनऽ नया सभा सुविधा के उद्घाटन करलकै, जेकरऽ उद्देश्य देश म॑ तेजी स॑ अपनऽ परिचालन के विस्तार करना छै ।नबका विधानसभा सुविधा मे 75,000 यूनिट प्रति वर्ष होयत आ संगहि नव निवेश अनबा आ एहि क्षेत्र मे नौकरी क अवसर पैदा करबा पर सेहो ध्यान देल जाएत।एकरा लेली हीरो मोटोकॉर्प न॑ सीजी मोटर्स के साथ साझेदारी करलकै, जे अधिकृत वितरक छै आरू देश म॑ बिक्री आरू सेवा नेटवर्क के विस्तार प॑ भी काम करतै ।इहो पढ़ू: हीरो मोटोकॉर्प मार्च 2024 मे 5.6 फीसदी मे गिरावट देखैत छथि, एहि सहयोग पर बिक्री टिप्पणी करैत छथि, संजय भान, मुख्य व्यवसाय अधिकारी - ग्लोबल बिजनेस यूनिट, हीरो मोटोकॉर्प कहलनि, “अपन मूल मे नवीनता आ तकनीक क संग हीरो मोटोकॉर्प वर्ल्ड उपलब्ध करेबाक लेल प्रतिबद्ध छथि -पूरे विश्व मे अपन ग्राहकक कें लेल उत्पाद आ अनुभवक कें कक्षा.ई हमरा सब लेल, सीजी मोटर्स आ नेपाल के लेल एकटा रोमांचक विकास अछि।अत्याधुनिक विधानसभा इकाई ई सुनिश्चित करतै कि हमरऽ विश्वस्तरीय उत्पाद अब॑ नेपाल म॑ बनलऽ रहतै आरू देश भर केरऽ ग्राहकऽ लेली उपलब्ध होतै ।बिक्री आरू सेवा नेटवर्क केरऽ तेजी स॑ विस्तार स॑ हमरा अपनऽ विश्वस्तरीय उत्पाद आरू सेवा स॑ बाजार म॑ जड़ जमाय सकै छै ।नेपाल म॑ हमरऽ नवीन फोकस, हमरऽ भागीदार सीजी मोटर के साथ, देश के प्रति हमरऽ प्रतिबद्धता क॑ प्रतिबिंबित करै छै, जे हमरा लेली एगो बहुत महत्वपूर्ण बाजार बनलऽ छै।”इहो पढ़ू: हीरो मवरिक 440 स्क्रैम्बलर नाम ट्रेडमार्क हीरो मोटोकॉर्प अपन चारिटा लोकप्रिय मॉडल - XPULSE 200 4V, सुपर स्प्लेंडर, स्प्लेन्डर+ मोटरसाइकिल आ Xoom 110 स्कूटर के नेपाल मे इकट्ठा करत.सीजी मोटर्स न॑ काठमांडू म॑ फ्लैगशिप शोरूम खोललकै आरू एकरऽ लक्ष्य छै कि अगला तीन महीना के भीतर १०० स॑ अधिक बिक्री आरू सेवा आउटलेट होतै ।

title: Nepal Police HQ directs 16 policemen to appear with explanations within seven days - Myrepublica
description: Nepal Police HQ directs 16 policemen to appear with explanations within seven days  Myrepublica
publisher.title: Myrepublica
full_article:
KATHMANDU, April 22: The Nepal Police Headquarters has issued instructions to 16 policemen who have been voluntarily absent since Falgun (mid-February to mid-March) to appear in.

On Monday, the police headquarters released the names and positions of the 16 absent policemen who are currently out of contact.

The absent officers include a technical police sub-inspector, two police assistant head constables, a police constable, and an office assistant.

According to the police headquarters, some of these individuals have been absent since the beginning of Falgun, while others have been missing since the end of the month.

The police headquarters stated that the public notice was issued as they were unable to establish contact with these officers despite conducting a search. The notice was published after completing the necessary procedures.

They have been instructed to appear before the authorities with an explanation within seven days from the publication date of the notice, excluding the day of publication.

Failure to comply may result in the Headquarters taking action to remove them from service as per police regulations.
translated: काठमांडू, 22 अप्रैल : नेपाल पुलिस मुख्यालय न॑ 16 पुलिसकर्मी सिनी क॑ निर्देश जारी करलकै जे फाल्गुन (मध्य-मध्य स॑ म॑ मिड-मार्च स॑) के बाद स॑ स्वेच्छा स॑ अनुपस्थित छै । सोमवार क॑ पुलिस मुख्यालय न॑ 16 केरऽ नाम आरू पदऽ के नाम आरू पद छोड़लकै । जे पुलिस एखन संपर्क सं बाहर अछि.अनुपस्थित अधिकारी सब में एकटा तकनीकी पुलिस उप निरीक्षक, दू टा पुलिस सहायक प्रमुख सिपाही, एकटा पुलिस सिपाही, आ एकटा कार्यालय सहायक शामिल अछि.पुलिस मुख्यालय के अनुसार फाल्गुन के शुरुआत सं एहि मे सं किछ व्यक्ति अनुपस्थित अछि, जखन कि किछ महीना के अंत सं गायब अछि.पुलिस मुख्यालय न॑ कहलकै कि सार्वजनिक सूचना जारी करलऽ गेलऽ छै, कैन्हेंकि वू खोज करला के बावजूद ई अधिकारी सिनी स॑ संपर्क स्थापित करै म॑ असमर्थ छै ।आवश्यक प्रक्रिया पूरा करला के बाद ई नोटिस प्रकाशित करलऽ गेलऽ छेलै ।प्रकाशन केरऽ दिन क॑ छोड़ी क॑ नोटिस केरऽ प्रकाशन के तिथि स॑ सात दिन के भीतर ओकरा सिनी के सामने स्पष्टीकरण के साथ प्राधिकारी के सामने पेश होय के निर्देश देलऽ गेलऽ छै ।अनुपालन मे विफलता कें परिणामस्वरूप मुख्यालय पुलिस नियमक कें अनुसार ओकरा सेवा सं हटावय कें लेल कार्रवाई करय सकय छै.

title: 'Make your future bright': Financial struggles set in for McCaskey grad, Nepal refugee Sujan Upreti - LNP | LancasterOnline
description: 'Make your future bright': Financial struggles set in for McCaskey grad, Nepal refugee Sujan Upreti  LNP | LancasterOnline
publisher.title: LNP | LancasterOnline
full_article:
Drawing more than 30,000 students into downtown Philadelphia creates a competitive job market – something that’s made it difficult for Temple University sophomore Sujan Upreti to secure even a part-time gig at Starbucks or a local pizza shop.

“It’s rare you get a job,” Upreti said.

Competition aside, Upreti wonders if he’d even be able to find the time as he balances an 18-credit course load and frequent trips back to his Lancaster city home to help out his family, who are all refugees from Nepal.

if (pianoDFPStatus.indexOf('subscriber') == -1) { document.write('<'+'sty'+'le>#placement_514232_0_i{width:100%;margin:0 auto;padding: 15px 0 !important;}</'+'sty'+'le>'); var rnd = window.rnd || Math.floor(Math.random()*10e6);var pid514232 = window.pid514232 || rnd;var plc514232 = window.plc514232 || 0;var abkw = window.abkw || '';var absrc = 'https://ads.empowerlocal.co/adserve/;ID=181918;size=0x0;setID=514232;type=js;sw='+screen.width+';sh='+screen.height+';spr='+window.devicePixelRatio+';kw='+abkw+';pid='+pid514232+';place='+(plc514232++)+';rnd='+rnd+';click=CLICK_MACRO_PLACEHOLDER';var _absrc = absrc.split("type=js"); absrc = _absrc[0] + 'type=js;referrer=' + encodeURIComponent(document.location.href) + _absrc[1];document.write('<scr'+'ipt src="'+absrc+'" type="text/javascript"></'+'script>'); }

Still, Upreti has to find some way to scrounge up enough money to cover the nearly $20,000 in tuition plus an additional $12,000 for room and board to pay for his upcoming third year at Temple University, where he is majoring in broadcast journalism. Scholarships that paid for years one and two have run out.

As his second year at the university comes to an end, it looks like he’ll be taking out a mixture of private and federal loans as he applies for even more scholarships or no-interest loans like the Lancaster Dollars for Higher Learning.

While paying for college is an obstacle for most U.S. college students, Upreti has the added concern of ensuring his family of six is getting by financially.

The Upreti family is among the 5,000 refugees who settled in Lancaster County between 2002 and 2019, with 301 making the move in 2019 alone, according to USA Today data. As a result, the School District of Lancaster has hundreds of students who are refugees from several countries, including the Democratic Republic of Congo, Ukraine and India, with many of them becoming or on their way to becoming the first generation of their families who’ve attended college.

This growing group of students face special cultural and financial hurdles in reaching their educational goals, and to provide insight into these circumstances, LNP | LancasterOnline has followed Upreti since his senior year at McCaskey High School with a series of articles documenting his experience.

Previous articles on Sujan Upreti:

'College really opened my eyes': McCaskey grad, Nepal refugee Sujan Upreti passes first semester at Temple

McCaskey grad, Nepal refugee Sujan Upreti begins school at Temple, juggles familial responsibilities

American Dreaming: Nepal refugee, McCaskey grad Sujan Upreti headed to Temple

The financial and academic pressure Upreti faces now are common among first generation college students from immigrant families.

‘See what you can afford’

First-generation immigrant college students are more likely than their counterparts to be saddled with debt coming out of college, said Jenny Hernandez, director of the Millersville University College Assistance Migrant Program, and these students are more likely to drop out of college after their first year.

That’s when the cost of college catches up to students, Hernandez said; 99.5% of scholarships apply to the first year while the added expense of books and technology pile up.

Hernandez said 60% of first-generation immigrant students nationally return to school in their sophomore year. The other 40% don’t come back.

“We have many students who struggle after the first year to come back for the following one because they didn’t have the support,” she said. “They didn’t have the money or they didn’t have a plan.”

It’s important, she said, for students to read the fine print in their financial aid packages when first selecting a college and to formulate a plan as to how they might afford what isn’t covered by scholarships, grants or federal assistance.

“I always say to my students ‘leave your fancy college for grad school,’” Hernandez said. “Right now, see what you can afford.”

For students like Upreti already a couple years into college, she suggests visiting the college’s financial aid office to find more scholarships. To Upreti’s credit, he said he’s applied for several more scholarships to pay for his last two years at Temple.

Or, she said, students can weigh the possibility of working a full or part-time job during college, even if that means extending a four-year degree across five, six or even eight years.

Upreti, however, is considering shortening, not lengthening his college career.

Buy Now Temple student Sujan Upreti, gets off the train after returning home for his birthday, at the Lancaster Train Station Wednesday Feb. 1, 2023. CHRIS KNIGHT | Staff Photographer

‘We have the responsibility’

Because Temple charges a flat-rate tuition for students taking between 12 and 18 credits, Upreti said he wants to take 18 credits each semester – at no more cost than it would take for 12 or 15 credits – to wrap up his college career a semester early, saving thousands of dollars. Credits are determined by the number of hours a student spends in class per week.

Midway through his second 18-credit semester, Upreti admitted, “I am kind of struggling.”

Part of the issue is balancing the academic load with circumstances and cultural expectations that require Upreti to provide significant help to his family.

Upreti and his cousin, Rabina Uprety (when Uprety and her immediate family immigrated to the U.S., government officials misspelled the family name Upreti as Uprety), grew up together and have always been close – studying together as they attended SDL and now, talking every day as they take on the challenges of college. Uprety is a junior at Millersville University, studying sociology and criminology.

The cousins are related through their fathers, who are brothers. Uprety came to the U.S. around the same time as Upreti, in 2010, when she was 7.

googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('ad-1010212'); });

She, too, has been working hard to take the financial onus off of her family, working 25 to 30 hours a week at Aldi on top of her course load. To pay for college, she tries to take out loans and pay them back herself. She does not ask her parents for money.

Upreti tries to give his parents $100 to $150 for gas or other household expenses when he’s able.

“We have the responsibility to look after our parents and the household since our siblings are younger than us,” Uprety said. “Everything, even college and even financially, we have to see what’s best for the family and us.”

When the two of them are overwhelmed by that responsibility, they turn to each other.

“My therapist is Sujan and his therapist is me,” Uprety said. “We share our struggles, our needs, our goals with one another.”

Both also lean on the help of community organizations like CAMP and the Martin Luther King Memorial Scholarship Fund. In his senior year at McCaskey, Upreti received $12,500 from the MLK fund that paid for much of his first and second semester at Temple.

When he realized he was running low on funds, he asked for help – and the organization issued an additional $5,000 from a donor to the scholarship fund. Members of the organization’s board have sent him applications for other scholarships that may help cover his costs, Upreti said.

Over the summers, he’s worked at Namaste Restaurant on Columbia Avenue in East Hempfield Township and taken on the occasional odd job to save up for his books and other supplies. If he secures an internship in the coming summers, unpaid or paid, he plans to work a second job to help finance college.

READ: Millersville University joins Every Campus A Refuge initiative to support refugees seeking resettlement

‘We need to struggle’

That drive to work hard in the hopes of supporting not only himself but his family is generational.

It’s a characteristic that’s been instilled in Upreti by his father, Khem Upreti, and instilled in Khem Upreti by his father before him.

Buy Now The Upreti family from the left, Goma, Khem, Khagendra, Sujan and Rajen Upreti. The six-year-old sister, Prisha Upreti, was still in school when this photo was taken on Wednesday, March 30, 2022. Sujan, second from the right, and his family are refugees here in the U.S. from Nepal, and they're originally from Bhutan. Sujan plans to study broadcasting when he picks a college. Suzette Wenger

“Life is a struggle, but we need to struggle in our life so that’s OK,” Khem Upreti said.

Khem Upreti has worked at Dart Container in Upper Lacock Township since 2015. Before that he worked at Lancaster General Hospital. When Sujan, his youngest son, is away, he works full-time, gets his youngest daughter Prisha Upreti off to school, pays the bills and takes care of other household chores.

Sujan’s mother, Goma Upreti, had back and shoulder surgery that left her physically unable to do much without help. Most nights, Khem said he sleeps only three to four hours.

“I’m a little bit tired, but it’s OK,” Khem insisted.

When Sujan is home, he helps Khem with bills he’s struggling to read due as Khem sometimes struggles with English. Sujan said his father learned English in Nepal but that what he learned there is dissimilar to the English actually used in the U.S. Sujan helps Prisha to complete her homework and sign up for after-school events.

“I feel alone in my home,” when Sujan is at college, Khem said, “because he’s helping a lot when he’s home.”

Khem might ask for that help from time to time, but always with the caveat that if Sujan is tight on time, he should make education his priority.

Khem’s main hope is that Sujan can finish college with a high grade point average – Sujan has maintained around a 3.8 to 3.9 GPA on a 4.0 scale for the first two years – and secure a job that allows him to provide for his children the way Khem has provided for him.

“The main thing is you have to focus on your education,” Khem recalls telling Sujan. “You can make your future bright.”

करलकै ।जखन ओकर छोटका बेटा सुजन दूर रहैत अछि, तखन ओ पूर्णकालिक काज करैत अछि, अपन छोट बेटी प्रीशा उपरेटी केँ स्कूल मे उतारैत अछि, बिल भरैत अछि आ घरक काजक देखभाल करैत अछि ।सुजन केरऽ माय गोमा उपरेटी केरऽ पीठ आरू कंधा केरऽ सर्जरी होय गेलऽ छेलै जेकरा स॑ ओकरा बिना मदद के बहुत कुछ नै करै म॑ असमर्थ होय गेलऽ छेलै ।बेसी राति खेम कहलक जे ओ मात्र तीन स चारि घंटा सुतैत अछि।खेम जोर देलकै, “हम कनि थाकि गेल छी, मुदा ठीक छै।”सुजन घर छै, खेम के बिल के साथ मदद करै छै जेकरा वू पढ़ै लेली संघर्ष करी रहलऽ छै, कैन्हेंकि खेम कखनी-कखनी अंग्रेजी के साथ संघर्ष करै छै।सुजन न॑ कहलकै कि ओकरऽ पिता नेपाल म॑ अंग्रेजी सीखलकै लेकिन वू जे कुछ सीखलकै, वू अमेरिकी सुजन म॑ वास्तव म॑ इस्तेमाल करलऽ जाय वाला अंग्रेजी स॑ विषम छै, जेकरा म॑ प्रीशा म॑ ओकरऽ होमवर्क पूरा करै म॑ मदद करै छै आरू स्कूल के बाद के आयोजन लेली साइन अप करै छै ।“हमरा अपन घर मे असगर महसूस होइत अछि,” जखन सुजन कॉलेज मे रहैत छथि त’ खेम कहलनि, “कारण ओ घर मे रहला पर बहुत मदद करैत छथि।”खेम समय-समय पर ओ मदद मांगि सकैत अछि, मुदा सदिखन एहि चेतावनी के संग जे जँ सुजन समय पर टाइट अछि त ओकरा अपन प्राथमिकता बनेबाक चाही।खेम केरऽ मुख्य आशा छै कि सुजन हाई ग्रेड प्वाइंट औसत के साथ कॉलेज पूरा करी सकै छै – सुजन न॑ पहिलऽ दू साल स॑ ४.० पैमाना प॑ लगभग ३.८ स॑ ३.९ जीपीए क॑ बरकरार रखन॑ छै – आरू ओकरा एगो ऐसनऽ काम सुरक्षित करी लेल॑ छै जेकरा स॑ ओकरा अपनऽ बच्चा सिनी लेली वू तरह के प्रावधान करलऽ जाय सक॑ छै जेना खेम हुनका लेल प्रावधान केने छथि।खेम सुजन क॑ कहलकै कि मुख्य बात ई छै कि आपने क॑ अपनऽ शिक्षा प॑ ध्यान देना छै ।“अहाँ अपन भविष्यक उज्ज्वल बना सकैत छी।”रोज भोरे अपन इनबॉक्स पर भेजल गेल टॉप हेडलाइन चाही?हमर मुफ्त दैनिक एएम न्यूजलेटर के लेल एतय साइन अप करू।स्थानीय समाचार 'एक आदमी के लोग': एसडीएल में प्रथम अश्वेत शिक्षक, नागरिक अधिकार अग्रणी फ्रेडरिक एम. रीड 88 एशले स्टैलनेकर पर मृत्यु |स्टाफ लेखक स्थानीय समाचार लैंकेस्टर लेबनान आवास के लिए मानवता लॉन्च खुला दरवाजे भवन निर्माण अभियान Enelly Betancourt |La Voz संपादक और स्टाफ लेखक स्थानीय समाचार 'हम वापस जाना चाहते हैं वापस जाना चाहते हैं': यूक्रेनी शरणार्थी में लैंकेस्टर काउंटी के सामना अनिश्चित भविष्य enelly Betancourt |ला वोज संपादक एवं स्टाफ लेखक
